alert.note: Alert for Greater Vancouver Area; South Washington Cascade Foothills (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 06 at 8:57PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...STICKING SNOW POSSIBLE AS LOW AS 500 FEET TONIGHT... A band of persistent, moderate to locally heavy precipitation is crossing northward into Washington, already affecting much of Clark County as of 845 PM. While the snow level is generally 1000 to 1500 feet tonight, this band of precipitation may result in quick, slushy snow accumulations of up to 2 inches for elevations as low as 500 to 700 feet. This would impact towns such as Amboy and Yacolt, as well as the higher elevations of Battle Ground, as well as the foothills of the south Washington Cascades. This particular band of precipitation should diminish by 11 PM, but additional rain and snow showers are possible tonight.

area.areaDesc: Greater Vancouver Area; South Washington Cascade Foothills
